channel.title: Reccommended Java Books
channel.description:
Well guys, I'm trying to learn Java and I've been looking for some good books. I have "Head First Java" right now and it's been pretty good so far but, I need something that will teach me everything I need to know and should know. My book is doing a good job but really isn't explaining the basics too well. I have been learning the meanings online so it's working fine so far so the book is having an effect.
I'm sort of looking for under the $50.00 price range, and please don't bother me with ebooks. I can't stand reading 700 pages on the internet, it'll kill my eyes[plus it's just annoying and uncomfortable]. So thanks.

item.title: Reccommended Java Books
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Unhandled:

I thought moparscape uses the Jagex Development Kit (JDK) which is way different…

Yes I Heard Thats Why You Have To Set Class Paths In Your System 32

Read full topic

item.title: Reccommended Java Books
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

Heres how I did it, I started with RSPS about two years ago, quit that, and bought Java for Dummies, and the 9 books in one Java for Dummies. Those books taught the basics very well, everything after that I used the Java API to teach me.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Westbay:

to be honest proper Java is different from “rsps java”

Hah, no. The fact everyone on moparscape codes like a retard does not mean they are somehow different, just that everyone there is terrible.

Read full topic

item.title: Reccommended Java Books
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

I learnt from Head-First’s Java book. I dont understand your complaints about it not covering the basics. For sure its not in the same order as the official sun tutorial, but stick with and you will see why they appear to jump back and forwards. It’s a great book, youve definitely already stumbled on the best. The whole series is great, and if the sometimes childish approach bothers you go for the standard O’reilley(sp?) series they are in general great books aswell.

So far i ahve read learning Java, learning SQL and JSP and servlets from the headfirst series I highly recommend all of them!

Read full topic

item.title: Reccommended Java Books
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Syfal, post:9, topic:306532”][quote author=oksuper_ link=topic=402691.msg2984364#msg2984364 date=1254863827]

no single book will teach you all you need to/should know

not true m8 the bible does!!!
[/quote]
Agreed.[/quote]
Trolled like a motherfucker.

Read full topic

item.title: Reccommended Java Books
item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:6, topic:306532”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=402691.msg2983939#msg2983939 date=1254841723]
no single book will teach you all you need to/should know
[/quote]

not true m8 the bible does!!![/quote]

Agreed.

Anyway, the best way to learn Java is with the tutorials on java.sun.com. If you really need a book to start you off though, I recommend Java for Dummies, written by Doug Lowe. It’s 9 books in one, and covers a lot of the Java programming language. The last time I checked it was around $35.00, so it fits in your price range.

Read full topic
